overview:
Colin Roche is a serial entrepreneur and inventor and now Vice President of Business Development for CloudCrowd.

Prior to his role at CloudCrowd, Roche was founder and CEO of Pacific Writing Instruments. He founded the company based on a radically different design for a writing instrument, called PenAgain that he conceived of while sitting in a high school detention at Palo Alto High. The design was quickly adopted by the tech community for its sophisticated form factor. Colin and a partner and set up manufacturing overseas and built a distribution network of 25,000 retailers in 40 countries. Colin has been featured by CNBC, ABC, Fox News, Newsweek, Wired and profiled in one of the longest series the Wall Street Journal has ever published on a single business titled the “Long Road to Wal-Mart.”
